posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Both are level 8 spells, both lots of blind enemies. Sunburst will blind non undead too according to the wiki.

However sunburst has a huge number of additional advantages - party friendly, colossal area of effect (10m radius vs 3.3m radius for mass blindness/deafness), damage against undead, some damage against non undead, chance to kill vampires, permanent duration blindness.

The only positive for Mass Blindness only seems the fortitude save rather than reflex save, meaning it is more effective against evasion users who require to fail two reflex saves to have blindness (evasion - sunburst doesn't hit and no chance of blindness). However I am unsure if this is necessarily a positive as there are plenty of enemies ie warriors, clerics and mages who have low reflex saves to use sunburst against, fort is a strong save for warriors and divine casters, perhaps only a situational advantage.

Overall it looks like sunburst is a way better spell, curious that it isn't discussed as much as firebrand even. If they can't see you they can't hit you with spells or arrows, or move to your location to melee attack you

Of course this pales in comparison to the overpowered cleric Word of Faith spell which is a party friendly colossal radius spell which will blind anyone without a save, as long as spell penetration is sufficient. I think lets not go there.

Anyone got any experience with sunburst and non undead and finding it useful? It seems like a very powerful spell on par with the big stuff like Wail, Wilting and firebrand.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I'd take sunburst over mb/d every time. Sunburst is a great spell against undead. It is a DC spell with a reflex save. It does far more damage than eg. firebrand. 
Even with a sorcerer and limited spell selection, sunburst is on my spell lvl 8 list together with horrid wilting and greater sanctuary. Early on premonition is on that list too, but it soon becomes obsolete when +5 weapons start to pop up. Bigby 8 can be replaced by both B7 and B9. Mind blank can be substituted by lesser mind blank, clarity and protection from alignment.
